questions.question: What entity did Jesse Pollak request Neynar make a ticket for on December 12, 2025?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak's post on 2025-12-12 states: '@neynar make @grin a ticket for this'.

questions.question: Which specific tokens did Jesse Pollak state he held 4 out of 12 of, leading him to consider himself a 'TRADER' on a mini app?
questions.explanation: JP's post on 2025-12-09 mentions: 'I have 4/12 top Clanker tokens.'

questions.question: Jesse Pollak stated the progression of blockchain interaction as: 'We read a chain now, we write to a chain next.' What metaphorical imagery did he use to represent this goal?
questions.explanation: The post ends with 'ü™ê' (a planet/satellite emoji), symbolizing the transition to writing to the chain.

questions.question: What is Jesse Pollak's top stated priority for Developer infra, according to his November 26, 2025, post?
questions.explanation: The post lists '1. Developer infra: Farcaster + onchain data' as the top priority.

questions.question: What new experiment did Dan Romero announce on December 12, 2025, to help Clanker projects get discovered?
questions.explanation: DR's post introduces the 'New experiment: Weekly Clanker Roundup'.

questions.question: Which three key financial features were listed under the 'Wallet' priority in Dan Romero's December 12, 2025, update?
options: Yield, Limit orders, Prototyping prediction markets
Custody solutions, Federal licensing, Fee sinks
Clanker integration, Burner pool extension, Presales
questions.explanation: The Wallet priorities listed are: 'Yield - Limit orders - Prototyping prediction markets - Manual trader outreach'.

questions.question: What onchain asset did Brian Armstrong mint that is described as carrying a bit of his Farcaster best friend's DNA?
questions.explanation: BA's post on 2025-12-15 states: 'I just minted a petlet. My Warplet now carries a small and reassuring best friend.'

questions.question: Who did Brian Armstrong mention in December 2025 as the person he honestly wouldn't be here without?
questions.explanation: BA posted on 2025-12-11: 'i honestly wouldn't be here if linda wasn't here'.

questions.question: What type of data did Jesse Pollak ask Neynar to analyze for him on November 1, 2025?
options: The total number of casts in the last year
How many likes across the entire Farcaster protocol in the past 24 hours
questions.explanation: JP's post on 2025-11-01 asks: '@neynar how many likes across the entire farcaster protocol in the past 24 hours?'

questions.question: According to Jesse Pollak, what action does not lower a user's Neynar score?
options: Using Farcaster through the Base app
Failing to refill the coffee machine water tank
questions.explanation: JP's post on 2025-10-15 explicitly states: 'Using farcaster through the Base app does not lower your Neynar score'.

questions.question: The provided posts show that a user closed on their first house using money made almost entirely on Farcaster from which combination of tokens/projects?
questions.explanation: Dan Romero quotes a user on 2025-12-13 listing: 'Degen, Higher, Anon, Clanker, Aether.'

questions.question: Which mini app did Brian Armstrong encourage users to help get to #1 by joining the $QR auction bid?
questions.explanation: BA posted on 2025-12-10: 'let's get wishlist.holiday miniapp to #1'

questions.question: What specific feature of the prints mini app built by @priyanka did Jesse Pollak praise?
options: The admin view to see orders coming in
questions.explanation: JP's post on 2025-11-13 states: 'my favorite part was the admin view that @priyanka set up for herself to see the orders coming in.'

questions.question: In his priorities list, what specific application type did Jesse Pollak associate with 'vibe code'?
questions.explanation: Priority 3 is listed as: 'App studio: vibe code mini apps'.

questions.question: Who did Brian Armstrong credit for being a 'great santa this year' in relation to the wishlist creation?
questions.explanation: BA thanked '@myk for being a great santa this year' on 2025-12-09.

questions.question: According to the Anthropic report cited by Jesse Pollak, what percentage of vulnerabilities in the post-March 2025 benchmark could be exploited autonomously by current AI agents?
questions.explanation: JP's post on 2025-12-02 quotes the report stating a jump to '55.88%'.

questions.question: What is the third top priority listed by Jesse Pollak on November 26, 2025, following Developer infra and Neynar AI?
options: App studio: vibe code mini apps
questions.explanation: The list is 1. Developer infra, 2. Neynar AI, 3. App studio: vibe code mini apps.

questions.question: What specific characteristic did Jesse Pollak ask Neynar to analyze his past casts for on November 18, 2025?
questions.explanation: JP asked Neynar to 'analyze my casts over the last year and tell me my biggest weakness'.

questions.question: What specific criteria did Jesse Pollak set for Neynar when introducing him to new followers, asking the AI to focus on his 'projects, interests, and vibe'?
options: Do not mention Base or Coinbase
Write as if you're telling a friend about me
questions.explanation: JP's post on 2025-10-10 instructs Neynar to 'write as if you're telling a friend about me.'

questions.question: In the Clanker priorities list, what specific mechanism is being 'rethought' or revamped related to token distribution?
questions.explanation: The list mentions: 'Rethinking how to do presales / fair launch'.

questions.question: Which US banking product did Dan Romero highly recommend, rating it 10/10?
questions.explanation: DR's post on 2025-12-11 states: 'Mercury is the best US full-service banking product. 10/10'.

questions.question: Brian Armstrong reported a bug where some casts resulted in a 404 error and the Neynar API returned a different cast. Which user's account was specifically affected by these 'disappeared' casts?
questions.explanation: BA's post on 2025-12-11 specifically referenced issues with casts 'disappeared' from our '@beeper account'.

questions.question: What organization did Brian Armstrong say his bid on the daily $QR auction would support?
questions.explanation: BA posted on 2025-12-12: 'join my bid on today's $QR auction to support them' (referring to @vmfcoin).

questions.question: According to Dan Romero, what two types of buyers represent the remaining marginal buyers after ETFs pushed markets to $120K?
options: Hedge funds and institutional money managers
Sovereigns and 'One funeral at a time' institutional money manager shift
Mini app traders and retail degens
questions.explanation: DR listed: '1. Sovereigns... 2. 'One funeral at a time' institutional money manager shift'.

questions.question: Besides adding general agent capabilities, what specific type of agent functionality did Jesse Pollak prioritize building on Neynar AI?
questions.explanation: Priority 2 is: 'Neynar AI: add agent capabilities, build in-feed agents on neynar'.

questions.question: According to the Anthropic report cited by Jesse Pollak, what was the total exploit revenue capability increase for AI agents in 2025?
questions.explanation: The post states the leap was 'from $5,000 to $4.6 million in total exploit revenue.'

questions.question: What 'side effect of the Coinbase hack' did Jesse Pollak lament, relating to security practices?
options: Inability to use different/pseudo phone numbers across services
The rise in rent prices in the Bay Area
The failure of the Clanker multivaults
questions.explanation: JP's post discusses the inability to use different/pseudo phone numbers like with 'hide my email' addresses after the hack.

questions.question: Under the Clanker priority list, what action is planned regarding the Burner Pool?
options: It is being revamped to Multivaults
It is being converted to a fee sink
questions.explanation: The list mentions: 'Fee sinks, burner pool extension'.

questions.question: What specific metrics related to the Farcaster App did Dan Romero share a two-year chart for?
questions.explanation: DR's post on 2025-12-11 shows 'Farcaster App DAU / WAU / MAU for the last 2 years'.

questions.question: What token/project did Brian Armstrong mention he was 'shilling' in a 'brick side chat'?
questions.explanation: BA posted on 2025-12-09: 'shilling @petrock in brick side chat lol'.

questions.question: What type of mini app was Brian Armstrong seeking to track on Farcaster?
options: A global sentiment index for farcaster
An AI agent for automating tasks
questions.explanation: BA asked: 'Is there a miniapp that tracks a global sentiment index for farcaster?'

questions.question: What was the first role that Coinbase (Mircea P.) began hiring for after closing their fundraising round in late 2023?
questions.explanation: Coinbase's post on 2023-11-17 specified: 'the first role we're hiring for is a product designer'.

questions.question: Dan Romero mentioned that federal licenses would be 'especially great' to pre-empt regulation from which state financial regulatory body?
options: NYDFS (New York Department of Financial Services)
questions.explanation: DR's post on 2025-12-12 states: 'Especially great to pre-empt NYDFS.'

questions.question: Following the launch of the prints app, Jesse Pollak expected more transaction-enabled apps to be shipped next, specifically built using which studio/tool?
questions.explanation: JP mentioned: 'more of these transaction-enabled apps built on nas getting shipped next week.' (Neynar App Studio).

questions.question: Which individual did Dan Romero mention was making progress supporting Clanker ecosystem builders?
questions.explanation: DR's post on 2025-12-12 mentions: '@linda has been making progress supporting Clanker ecosystem builders'.

questions.question: What specific feature did Brian Armstrong highlight about his Q60 QMK keyboard?
options: It had a silent rubber dome
Aluminum casing adds a nice solid weight to it
It was compatible with Petlet DNA
questions.explanation: BA's post on 2025-12-10 mentioned: 'Q60 QMK - aluminum casing adds a nice solid weight to it'.

questions.question: What is the intended next feature for the Mini App studio after general availability, according to Jesse Pollak's October 13, 2025, post?
options: Replying to /someone-build casts with the mini apps
questions.explanation: JP stated: 'next up - replying to /someone-build casts with the mini apps'.

questions.question: What activity was listed under the 'Wallet' priority list that focused on engaging specific users?
questions.explanation: The last item listed under Wallet priorities is 'Manual trader outreach'.

questions.question: What was the official Base account's explanation for doubling its revenue the week before March 15, 2024?
questions.explanation: The post says: 'last week we doubled our revenue and I have no idea why'.

questions.question: Which three individuals did Brian Armstrong explicitly thank for being his 'onchain family' in December 2025?
questions.explanation: BA thanked '@svvvg3.eth @katkartel.eth @mintedmerch' on 2025-12-13.

questions.question: In Jesse Pollak's request for Neynar to introduce him to new followers, what specific types of data was he explicit about excluding from the introduction?
questions.explanation: JP instructed Neynar: 'don't talk about stats like followers or other internal data.'

questions.question: Jesse Pollak often refers to future timelines (e.g., 'is it 2061 yet?'). What widely referenced cultural or technological concept within the Ethereum/Web3 space does the year 2061 typically symbolize?
options: The year Ethereum is fully quantum-resistant
The year the EIP-1559 implementation completes
The date vitalik.eth is expected to return to the internet
A reference to Arthur C. Clarke's sci-fi sequel '2061: Odyssey Three'
questions.explanation: While not directly stated, within the crypto ecosystem, 2061 is frequently referenced as a nod to Arthur C. Clarke's 'Odyssey' series, often used humorously to suggest a long future horizon.

questions.question: What custom keyboard model did Brian Armstrong describe as having 'super silent keys'?
questions.explanation: BA posted on 2025-12-13: 'custom build DZ60RGB super silent keys'.

questions.question: What does the acronym BDFOFF, used by Dan Romero in his semi-regular Farcaster annoyances thread, stand for?
options: Base Developer Feedback On Farcaster Feature
Benevolent Dictator For One Farcaster Feature
Base Degen Feedback On Future Features
questions.explanation: DR's post on 2025-12-11 asks users what they would work on if they were 'BDFOFF = benevolent dictator for one farcaster feature'.

questions.question: Which two specific modifications were listed under the Clanker priorities related to fee management?
options: Fee sinks and burner pool extension
Revamping Spotlight and Manual trader outreach
questions.explanation: The priorities mention: 'Fee sinks, burner pool extension'.

questions.question: The integration of 'agent capabilities' is listed as a priority for which specific product within the developer ecosystem?
questions.explanation: Priority 2 is listed as: 'Neynar AI: add agent capabilities, build in-feed agents on neynar'.

questions.question: Mircea Pasoi (Coinbase) built an incomplete Python port of which specific Farcaster component?
questions.explanation: Coinbase's post on 2023-04-09 states he built an incomplete Python port of '@farcaster/hub-nodejs'.

questions.question: Jesse Pollak referred to himself as a 'TRADER' specifically due to holding Clanker tokens on what platform?
questions.explanation: JP stated: 'I didn‚Äôt consider myself one but on this mini app I'm a TRADER!' (referencing his Clanker tokens).

questions.question: Which specific Clanker project or publication is planned to be revamped alongside the new weekly Clanker roundup?
questions.explanation: The priorities mention: 'Revamping Clanker Spotlight / new weekly roundup'.

questions.question: The newly minted 'Petlet' is described as carrying DNA and being a small friend to which other listed onchain asset owned by Brian Armstrong?
questions.explanation: BA's post states: 'My Warplet now carries a small and reassuring best friend [the Petlet].'
